content: *note there s been confusion with the arrow symbol on the chart it should be the triangle symbol in the key and a s2kp *note 2 there s been some confusion with when to change needle size it s in the border/charted lace section row 1-33 are worked with size 6 row 34 changes to size 8 and the bind off is worked with size 10 this makes the edge more elastic for easier blocking this pattern is offered as a variation on maggie magali s southernselkie s ginkgo shoulderette shawl it reshapes the shawl from a triangle to a crescent and adjusts the lace border accordingly light and lacy this shoulderette is knit in a fingering weight yarn with a ginkgo leaf border it s perfect for casually wrapping around the neck or draping over the shoulders on crisp autumn or chilly spring days and elegant enough for an evening wrap as well with medium-sized needles and straightforward construction this is a reasonably quick knit - not terribly complicated but with just a bit of challenge in working the lace pattern on both sides the pattern is written for a small shoulderette but gives options for larger sizes materials madelinetosh tosh merino light 100% superwash merino wool 420yd/384m per skein for a shoulderette or small shawl 1 skein for medium or large shawls 1 5-2 skeins skills needed increasing decreasing reading a chart and thanks to wirledpeas kate hiester for her assistance with test-knitting and chart formatting
